lead: AI is transforming industries and operational strategies, with organizations focusing on responsible implementation and effective governance.

stories.title: AI Goals for 2026: What Every Organisation Should Prioritise
stories.summary: As organizations begin 2026, AI has evolved from isolated pilot projects to a core component of business strategy. Companies are encouraged to prioritize responsible AI practices, ensuring that technology aligns with their long-term goals and enhances operational efficiency. This shift reflects a broader recognition of AI's potential to drive innovation and competitive advantage.

stories.title: AIエージェント時代の脅威モデル入門──「自律性」が増やす攻撃面をどう捉えるか
stories.summary: The rise of AI agents introduces new threat models that extend beyond traditional software vulnerabilities. These agents' autonomy and decision-making capabilities can amplify risks, including data breaches and unauthorized actions. Understanding these threats is crucial for organizations to develop robust security measures and ensure safe deployment of AI technologies.

stories.title: Why I'm recommending Google's Pixel Buds in 2026 (after years of passing on them)
stories.summary: After years of skepticism, the latest iteration of Google's Pixel Buds has impressed with significant improvements in sound quality and features. This shift highlights how advancements in AI-driven technology can enhance everyday devices, making them more appealing to consumers. The integration of AI in audio technology is reshaping user experiences.

stories.title: AIエージェントの秘密情報管理とログ設計
stories.summary: Effective management of sensitive information in AI agents is critical to prevent data leaks. Organizations must map out potential leakage pathways, including inputs, memory, and logs. By establishing strict protocols and ensuring compliance with data protection standards, companies can mitigate risks associated with AI deployment.

stories.title: Is Google's new $8 AI Plus plan worth it? How it compares to the $20 Pro subscription
stories.summary: Google's introduction of the AI Plus plan offers a more affordable option for users seeking enhanced features without the full cost of the Pro subscription. This move reflects the growing trend of companies making AI tools more accessible, allowing a wider audience to leverage advanced technology for personal and business use.

stories.title: AI layoffs or ‘AI-washing’?
stories.summary: The recent wave of layoffs in tech companies raises questions about the authenticity of AI's role in these decisions. Many organizations may be using AI as a scapegoat for workforce reductions, highlighting the need for transparency in how AI is integrated into business strategies and its impact on employment.

stories.title: VicWater backs more gov data-sharing to boost AI
stories.summary: VicWater's support for increased government data-sharing initiatives aims to enhance AI capabilities in the water sector. By leveraging shared data, organizations can improve decision-making processes and operational efficiency, showcasing the transformative potential of AI in public utilities.

stories.title: If AI can’t yet pass ‘Humanity’s Last Exam’, where does that leave ambitions for it?
stories.summary: The inability of AI to pass critical benchmarks raises fundamental questions about its future capabilities. As researchers continue to explore the limits of AI, the conversation shifts towards realistic expectations and the ethical implications of deploying AI in sensitive areas of society.
